definitions.definition: To press between two hard objects; to squeeze so as to alter the natural shape or integrity of it, or to force together into a mass.
To reduce to fine particles by pounding or grinding
To overwhelm by pressure or weight.
definitions.example: After the corruption scandal, the opposition crushed the ruling party in the elections

definitions.definition: To overcome completely; to subdue totally.
definitions.example: The sultan's black guard crushed every resistance bloodily.

definitions.definition: To be or become broken down or in, or pressed into a smaller compass, by external weight or force
To feel infatuation or unrequited love.
To give a compressed or foreshortened appearance to.
The action of the verb to crush.
A former method of execution by placing heavy weights on the victim.

definitions.example: Oh, your dog has leukemia? That’s crushing.
